info.description: Welcome to the Continu API. You can use our API to get access to learner completion information contained within Continu.
info.title: Continu API

get.description:
This endpoint lists all Assessments for specific users. Users should be specified as a comma separated list of email addresses for which the Assessment information is required.
You also have the option to specify a date range using the from or until Unix Epoch timestamp.

parameters.description: Comma Separated List of users for which to return the Assessment Completion List
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: UserId value expected (employee id, phone number, client defined id for users)
parameters.name: userid

parameters.description: Location value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: locations

parameters.description: Department value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: departments

parameters.description: Team value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: teams

parameters.description: Level value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: levels

parameters.description: Grade value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: grades

parameters.description: Comma Separated List of Assessment IDs for which to return the Assessment Completion List
parameters.name: assessment

parameters.description: From date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Until date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: until

parameters.description: Date-Range target field (from & until). This value can be started_date or passed_date indicating to which date field should the date-range be apply to. The default value is started_date
parameters.name: range_target

parameters.description: The Authorization Header and Token
parameters.name: Authorization

get.description:
This endpoint lists all Department's briefs, you may return them as a list size of 50 records, 100, or 500, and in a "compact", "summary", or "full" list type.
If omitted, the default values for the list are "compact" and 50 records.
If you want to return the next batch of 50, 100, or 500 records
The list To get the next group of records send id_from argument with the last id you received.

parameters.description: Optional Id from the last record previously returned. This will be the Id from which data is returned
parameters.name: id_from

parameters.description: Size of the returned list. This value can be 50, 100, or 500
parameters.name: list_size

parameters.description: Type of List to return. This value can be compact, summary, or full indicating the number of fields included in each element returned
parameters.name: list_type

parameters.description: Name value expected or comma separated list of values (Marketing, Engineering, Human Resources)
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: CreatedAt From date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: created_at_from

parameters.description: CreatedAt Until date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: created_at_until

parameters.description: The Authorization Header and Token
parameters.name: Authorization

post.description: This endpoint creates a Department instance

parameters.description: The Authorization Header and Token
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The Department to create
parameters.name: department

get.description: This endpoint gets the department corresponding to the given id.

parameters.description: Id for the department requested.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The Authorization Header and Token
parameters.name: Authorization

put.description: This endpoint replaces/updates a whole Department instance

parameters.description: Id for the Department requested to be replaced.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The Authorization Header and Token
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The Department to replace
parameters.name: department

get.description:
This endpoint lists all user's briefs, you may return them as a list size of 50 records, 100, 1000, etc, and in a "compact", "summary", or "full" list type.
If omitted, the default values for the list are "compact" and 50 records. You have the option to specify values for any of the fields returned regardless of the list type.
This can be a single value, or lists for string fields like emails, roles, and even from/until ranges for date fields like create_at, or first_login.
If you want to return the next batch of 50, 100, or 500 records
The list To get the next group of records send id_from argument with the last id you received.

parameters.description: Optional Id from the last record previously returned. This will be the Id from which data is returned
parameters.name: id_from

parameters.description: Size of the returned list. This value can be 50, 100, 500, 1000, or 5000
parameters.name: list_size

parameters.description: Type of List to return. This value can be compact, summary, or full indicating the number of fields included in each element returned
parameters.name: list_type

parameters.description: First Name value expected or comma separated list of values (George, Becky, Michael)
parameters.name: first_name

parameters.description: Last Name value expected or comma separated list of values (Smith, Senna, Carlson)
parameters.name: last_name

parameters.description: Email value or comma separated list of emails for which to return values
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Role value expected or comma separated list of values (admin, user, external)
parameters.name: role

parameters.description: UserId value expected (employee id, phone number, client defined id for users)
parameters.name: userid

parameters.description: Location value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: locations

parameters.description: Department value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: departments

parameters.description: Team value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: teams

parameters.description: Level value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: levels

parameters.description: Grade value expected or comma separated list of values (56b9938a9f176c1100e7e156, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e152, 56b9938a9f176c1100e7e154)
parameters.name: grades

parameters.description: IsManager value expected (true/false, t/f, 1/0)
parameters.name: is_manager

parameters.description: IsCollaborator value expected (true/false, t/f, 1/0)
parameters.name: is_collaborator

parameters.description: IsSuspended value expected (true/false, t/f, 1/0)
parameters.name: is_suspended

parameters.description: SuspendedOn From date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: suspended_on_from

parameters.description: SuspendedOn Until date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: suspended_on_until

parameters.description: FirstLogin From date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: first_login_from

parameters.description: FirstLogin Until date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: first_login_until

parameters.description: LastLogin From date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: last_login_from

parameters.description: LastLogin Until date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: last_login_until

parameters.description: UpdatedAt From date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: updated_at_from

parameters.description: UpdatedAt Until date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: updated_at_until

parameters.description: CreatedAt From date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: created_at_from

parameters.description: CreatedAt Until date in Unix time (AKA Epoch time, seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)
parameters.name: created_at_until

parameters.description: The Authorization Header and Token
parameters.name: Authorization

post.description: This endpoint creates a User instance

parameters.description: The Authorization Header and Token
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The User to create
parameters.name: user

parameters.description: Optionally, set to true if you don't want any emails to be sent. Default is false. Allowed values true/false, t/f, 1/0.
parameters.name: mute
